did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.repository: Special Collections, University of Virginia Library
did.abstract: The collection contains 6 photographs, 1860-1901, of individuals, including a female ex-slave, and of Red Sulphur Springs and Natural Bridge, Va.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Virginia Photographs, 1860-1901, Accession #11157, Special Collections Dept., University of Virginia Library, Charlottesville, Va.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: This letter was purchased by the University of Virginia Library from Jerry N. Showalter, Rare Books and Artifacts, Ivy, Va.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Information
scopecontent.p: The collections contains an 1860s photograph of Edmund Berkeley of Virginia, W.S. Mason of Alabama and George Spiller of Virginia by photographer H.B. Hillyer of Austin, Texas, and a photograph of Patsy Harden, an ex-slave of Staunton, Va.

There are also two undated photographs by Charles L. Maury of Salem, Va., of two scenes near Red Sulphur Springs, Roanoke; and two photographs, 1901, by M. Miley and Sons, Lexington, Va., of Natural Bridge, Va., including one of the railroad crossing and post office.
